page.title: 01HARDWICK LANDSCAPE
page.content: This rural area is dominated by a magnesian limestone escarpment, running north to south, on which stands{Hardwick Hall.}The high land to the east is high grade farmland, the lower westerly land is irregular and mainly grassland supporting cattle. Underneath the whole area lie coal measures, many of which have been worked out. No working mines exist, however, at the present time although there are several adjacent to the area. The villages within the area are{Ault {Hucknall, Stainsby, Hardstoft, {Astwith,}part of{Rowthorne}and part of {Glapwell. The motorway,{M1,}traverses the area south to north and is approximately central on the lower land. The local occupation is farming and tourism, others being commuters.
